Job Details

We build upon ideas that have guided generations, then share our discoveries to inspire generations to come. Your mission—your opportunity—is to seek out the answers that bring us one step closer. If you’re driven to discover, create, and inspire something that lasts a lifetime and beyond, you’re ready for JPL.

The Jet Propulsion Laboratory (JPL) is a world leader in robotic space exploration. Located in Pasadena, California, JPL has a casual, campus-like environment situated on 177 acres, in the foothills of the San Gabriel Mountains and offers a work environment unlike any other: we inspire passion, foster innovation, build collaboration, and reward excellence.

We are seeking a motivated and analytical individual that can work well, both independently and in a team environment, to serve as a Summer Undergraduate Student (SUM) in our Travel and Invoice Management Section, operating under the Controller and Financial Planning Office (CFPO).

Responsibilities

As an Accounting Summer Intern, you will be partnered/mentored by other staff members and will report to the Section Manager, Travel and Invoice Management.

Travel tasks include:

  • Working on day-to-day assignments under direct supervision.  Assignments will relate to a range of activities within Travel Accounting and Reservations including
    • Foreign travel pre-trip requirements tracking
    • Prepare estimate and actuals packages for NASA sponsored conferences
    • Audit expense reports
    • Audit excess lodging justification/support packages
  • Analyze conference travel spend on highly attended conferences.  Highlight key insights and trends.

Invoice Management tasks include:

  • Working on day-to-day assignments under direct supervision.  Assignments will relate to a range of activities within Accounts Payable Operations and Subcontract Accounting including
    • Validating invoice transactions
    • Entry of subcontract invoice header information
    • Tracking and follow up of aging invoices
    • Assist in running monthly reports and analysis
  • Accrual accuracy analysis of key subcontracts.

Qualifications

  • Must be currently enrolled at least half-time at an accredited college or university, pursuing a Bachelor’s Degree in Accounting, Economics, Finance, Business Management/Administration, or related disciplines with a graduation date of December 2023 or later
  • Minimum of a 3.0/4.0 GPA
  • Must be able to work full-time during the summer for an 10-12 week assignment
  • Completed coursework with exposure to standard principles, theories, concepts and techniques in Accounting, Auditing, Finance or Mathematics
  • Knowledge and experience with MS Office
  • Strong written and verbal communication skills and the ability to work in a team environment;
  • A passion or strong desire to explore the field of accounting, auditing, finance or business operations;
  • Strong presentation and interpersonal skills
  • Aptitude to interact in a collaborative manner with other departments and teams
  • Proficient with general purpose computer applications
  • Knowledge of data visualization software and presentation

The typical hourly rate for this job in Pasadena, California depending on education level is $16.11 as a freshman, $19 as a sophomore, $22 as a junior, $25 as a senior.

JPL has a catalog of benefits and perks that span from the traditional to the unique. This includes a variety of health, dental, vision, wellbeing, and retirement plans, paid time off, learning, rideshare, childcare, flexible schedule, parental leave and many more. Our focus is on work-life balance, and living healthy, fulfilling lives as we Dare Mighty Things Together. For benefits eligible positions, benefits are effective the first day of the month coincident with or immediately following the employee’s start date.

For further benefits information click Benefits and Perks
